segment.source: Migrating UE-V Settings Packages
segment.target: Migrating UE-V Settings Packages

segment.source: Migrating UE-V Settings Packages
segment.target: Migrating UE-V Settings Packages

segment.source: Migrating UE-V Settings Packages
segment.target: Migrating UE-V Settings Packages

segment.source: In the lifecycle of a Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) deployment, you might need to relocate the user settings packages either when migrating to a new server or for backup purposes.
segment.target: In the lifecycle of a Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) deployment, you might need to relocate the user settings packages either when migrating to a new server or for backup purposes.

segment.source: Migration of settings packages might be needed in the following scenarios:
segment.target: Migration of settings packages might be needed in the following scenarios:

segment.source: Upgrade of existing server hardware to a more modern server.
segment.target: Upgrade of existing server hardware to a more modern server.

segment.source: Migration of a settings storage location share from a lab to a production server.
segment.target: Migration of a settings storage location share from a lab to a production server.

segment.source: Simply copying the files and folders will not preserve the security settings and permissions.
segment.target: Simply copying the files and folders will not preserve the security settings and permissions.

segment.source: The following described steps will properly copy the settings package files with their NTFS permissions to a new share.
segment.target: The following described steps will properly copy the settings package files with their NTFS permissions to a new share.

segment.source: How to preserve UE-V settings packages when migrating to a new server
segment.target: How to preserve UE-V settings packages when migrating to a new server

segment.source: In a new location on a different server, create a new folder; for example, MySettings.
segment.target: In a new location on a different server, create a new folder; for example, MySettings.

segment.source: Disable sharing for the old folder share on the old server.
segment.target: Disable sharing for the old folder share on the old server.

segment.source: Move the existing settings packages to the new server with Robocopy from the command line.
segment.target: Move the existing settings packages to the new server with Robocopy from the command line.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To monitor the copy progress, open MySettings.txt with a log file reader such as Trace32.
segment.target: To monitor the copy progress, open MySettings.txt with a log file reader such as Trace32.

segment.source: Grant share-level permissions to the new share.
segment.target: Grant share-level permissions to the new share.

segment.source: Leave the NTFS permissions as they were set by Robocopy.
segment.target: Leave the NTFS permissions as they were set by Robocopy.

segment.source: On computers that run the UE-V agent, update the SettingsStoragePath configuration setting to the UNC path of the new share.
segment.target: On computers that run the UE-V agent, update the SettingsStoragePath configuration setting to the UNC path of the new share.
